headline: PG&E Bondholder Proposal Faces Headwinds in Bankruptcy Court
summary: A bondholder proposal to address the wildfire damage claims that drove PG&E Corp. into bankruptcy faces headwinds from wildfire victims. Major group of victims say they weren’t consulted on a plan, which includes $14 billion to cover damages that PG&E estimated at $30 billion or more.

headline: Lawmakers Push New Retirement Legislation
summary: Congress is making another push on legislation that could make it easier for small companies to offer 401(k) plans and for workers to guarantee themselves an annual income after they retire.

headline: New York Lawmakers Prepare Weekend Budget Votes

headline: Elizabeth Warren Gets Her Man

headline: Putin Pulls a Syria in Venezuela
summary: The Russian is betting he can prop up Maduro at little political cost.

headline: A Ninth Circuit Test for the White House
summary: Bowing to California Democrats may derail a pair of nominees.

headline: It’s Anyone’s Brexit Now

headline: May’s Brexit Deal Is Rejected for a Third Time by Lawmakers
summary: On the day long set for Britain to leave the EU, Parliament rejected Prime Minister Theresa May’s Brexit deal for a third time, leaving the country no closer to an exit plan after more than two years of bitter wrangling.

summary: In a six-decade career that included such celebrated films as “Cleo From 5 to 7” and “Vagabond,” the director was hard to pigeonhole, often blurring the line between feature and documentary.

headline: Venezuela Restructuring Options Emerge Among Creditors, Officials

headline: U.S. Dollar Caps Off Quarter With Gains
summary: The U.S. dollar finished a strong quarter in which worries about global economic growth lifted the currency. The British pound fell about 1.3% against the dollar as U.K. lawmakers remained divided over Brexit.

headline: FBI, Retooling Once Again, Sets Sights on Expanding Cyber Threats
summary: The FBI has launched its biggest transformation since the 2001 terror attacks to retrain and refocus special agents to combat cyber criminals, whose threats to lives, property and critical infrastructure have outstripped U.S. efforts to thwart them.

headline: Trump Moves Again to Clear Path for Keystone XL Pipeline
summary: President Trump removed a roadblock to construction of TransCanada’s Keystone XL oil pipeline, issuing a permit that effectively allows the much-delayed project to move forward without further federal environmental review.

headline: Apple Cancels AirPower Charging Pad
summary: Apple said it canceled its wireless charging mat called AirPower, marking a rare product cancellation after the company promised it to customers nearly two years ago.

headline: Fresenius to Pay More Than $231 Million to Resolve Foreign Corruption Probe

headline: Mysteries: The Criminal and the Merely Guilty

headline: Coinbase’s Incentive for Crypto Customers: Interest Payments

headline: Parents in College-Admissions Case Discuss Plea Deals With Prosecutors

headline: Democratic Presidential Candidates Release Tax Returns, Urge Others to Follow Suit

headline: Utah Allowed to Limit Voter-Approved Medicaid Expansion

headline: McMahon to Step Down as SBA Chief

headline: If Golan to Israel Is OK, How About Crimea to Russia?
